thread_replies.author: CamZacc
thread_replies.text: Helped me understand a lot of what's going on in the trailer, dang. Translations are rough but it works.

thread_replies.author: Man_like_Future
thread_replies.text: It's also intriguing that director Satoru Katsumune is involved. His style is known for carefully depicting psychological portrayals and the delicate emotions of characters, so how the human drama of the protagonist and his comrades intertwines with the air battles is a key point

thread_replies.author: Iceman Tiffany blue stones
thread_replies.text: Interesting ey

thread_replies.author: Man_like_Future
thread_replies.text: Particularly noteworthy is the fact that it goes beyond a mere air combat simulation to depict the "Ace Experience," which includes not only flying fighter jets but also life on an aircraft carrier. Previous ''Ace Combat'' titles focused mainly on the aerial battles themselves,

thread_replies.author: Man_like_Future
thread_replies.text: This sounds interesting! Judging from the phrase that "Ace Combat 8" will "legitimately deepen" the series, it feels like it's inheriting the strengths of past titles while further pursuing new experiences and realism.

thread_replies.author: AgriHopper Ltd
thread_replies.text: The image of a hero depicted by director Kazuhiro Furuhashi goes beyond merely the exploits of a pilot, delving deeply into human drama.

thread_replies.author: AgriHopper Ltd
thread_replies.text: This installment, crafted with a focus on the legitimate evolution of the series, offers an immersive experience that is its charm, allowing players to not only pilot fighter jets but also experience life on an aircraft carrier.
